title: Chris Metzen returns to Blizzard full-time to create 'the next generation of adventures' in World of Warcraft
description: Metzen retired from Blizzard in 2016, but took on an "advisor" role in 2022—and now he's back for real.

title: Baldur's Gate 3 voice actors playing D&D as their characters is as fun to watch as you'd hope
description: And yes, everyone wants Shadowheart to cast Shadowheart's favorite cantrip.

title: We asked a professional miniatures painter to try his hand at Moonbreaker
description: The turn-based tactics game claims to be a true digital miniatures experience—so we asked Squidmar to put it to the test.

title: Voice actors vote overwhelmingly to approve a strike: 'It’s time for the videogame companies to stop playing games'
description: They're not actually on strike yet, but it could happen if negotiations for a new contract fall through.

title: Cyberpunk's many patches have transformed the game, but it's still missing the one feature from the trailers that sold me on Night City
description: After three years, I can't believe Night City is still missing a working metro system.

title: Todd Howard says Starfield's planetary survival systems were originally 'very punitive' but 'we just nerfed the hell out of it'
description: Dealing with afflictions and hostile planetary conditions used to be "a pretty complex" system but it was heavily scaled back.

title: Payday 3 review
description: A slick, co-op FPS anchored to a charmless grind.

title: EVE Online director wants players to be able to download its grandest battles as replays and do post-match analysis like football
description: Just like "the football coach saying 'the lads played well', you know?"

title: Ransomware group claims to have hacked 'all of Sony systems,' Sony is investigating
description: The group is offering the data for sale, but it's not clear yet what exactly it has.

title: EVE Online's director has a simple message for its players: 'Cry havoc, and let loose the dogs of war!'
description: "I don't like nerf cycles, the 'make it worse make it better' kind of thing."

title: Squealing pigs, disgruntled bison, and the most beautiful frying meat I've ever seen: Dragon's Dogma 2 is just as wonderfully weird as the first game
description: If strapping an explosive mine to a troll's head is wrong, then I don't want to be right.

title: Todd Howard says that Starfield's ship AI sucks on purpose so players can actually hit stuff: 'You have to make the AI really stupid'
description: Not everyone can make the Kessel Run in less than twelve parsecs.

title: Kerbal Space Program 2 has been spamming your Windows registry with junk since launch, but a fix is being tested right now
description: The developer is now aware of the issue and is currently testing a fix it will release as a hotfix update.

title: 10 years after it died, Toontown Online is more alive than ever
description: Disney's MMO was killed in 2013, but private servers ensured it never truly went away.

title: Final Fantasy 14 is a 400-hour-plus epic you can share with your friends, and I'm not sure we'll see anything like it again
description: On stories, the MMORPG, and big turducken games.

title: Capcom stirs the pot, saying 'game prices are too low'
description: And doesn't think a recession will stop people spending money on games.

title: 2023's been such a ridiculous year for PC gaming that the major releases don't fit on a 1TB SSD
description: Nearly half of 2023's major releases also recommend running on an SSD.

title: How and when you can get Cyberpunk 2077 Twitch drops
description: You'll need to own the Phantom Liberty DLC to qualify.

title: Baldur's Gate 3's latest patch has introduced a 'very frustrating, borderline unplayable' glitch that makes companions dump their inventories on you
description: The shared stash system is sharing too much.

title: The Iron Throne is Baldur's Gate 3's best dungeon, and also its most stressful
description: A high-stakes prison break provides the game's toughest combat challenge, and some surprisingly organic story moments.

title: Cyberpunk 2077 2.0's new Edgerunners easter eggs just hit me with an existential crisis all over again
description: Gonna take you there myself, fly you to the moon. That's a promise.

title: Samsung's new low power, high performance memory range could be a serious boon for compact gaming laptops
description: The ickle upgradeable memory modules offer higher performance than traditional SO-DIMMS with most of the benefits of soldered-on memory.

title: Mario 64 speedrunners have cracked a 10-year-old problem, turning it from a Twitch chat meme into a must-use strat using algorithms and raw determination
description: 'Go carpetless'.

title: CD Projekt is putting your Cyberpunk 2077 mods on ice to make sure they don't wreak havoc with Phantom Liberty
description: The studio wants to give modders a chance to update their work to be compatible with the DLC.

title: Bayonetta creator and co-founder Hideki Kamiya to leave Platinum: 'Keep your eyes peeled'
description: "This came after a lot of consideration based on my own beliefs."

title: Phantom Liberty's wildest gun quickhacks enemies with bullets, but it's hard to find
description: GRIS-GRIS can turn gunfights into total chaos.

title: Valve launches SteamVR 2.0 beta with 'goal of bringing all of what's new on the Steam platform into VR'
description: Good sounds coming out of Valve this week for any virtual reality aficionados.

title: VR still makes 40-70% of players want to throw up, and that's a huge problem for the companies behind it
description: Why virtual reality makes a lot of us sick, and what we can do about it.

title: Should you help Songbird or Reed in Cyberpunk 2077: Phantom Liberty?
description: Let Songbird escape or capture her for Reed.

title: ChatGPT update gives it eyes and ears
description: It evolves...

title: Radeon boss Scott Herkelman will leave AMD at the end of the year
description: He hopes the company beats 'the final boss'.

title: NYT Connections hint and answers today: September 26 (#107)
description: Congratulations: you're now just a quick scroll away from winning Tuesday's game of Connections.

title: Microsoft's data centers of the future could be nuclear powered
description: Now that's a power up!

title: Today's Wordle hint and answer #829: Tuesday, September 26
description: Trouble solving today's Wordle? Here's the help you need.
